question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Basic concepts of food web, fascinating case studies in the field of ecology

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Community ecology, Mathematica, R, theoratical ecology

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Food web structure and how to apply the differential equations into modeling components in Mathematica.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learn about:Using R for ecological data analysis: I learned to use R to analyze food web data and create statistical models.Mathematical representation of ecological relationships: I learned to express ecological interactions through mathematical models, which helped me understand ecosystem dynamics.Ecological interpretation of food webs: I developed the ability to interpret food web relationships and how they affect energy and nutrient flow in ecosystems.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The class was very interactive

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Everything!! I like the way using whiteboard as well as Mathematica

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Jean was incredibly engaging and a great teacher - he would always be sure to connect theory back to real ecology scenarios. I really appreciated the primers for linear algebra to preface some of the classes. I also really enjoyed the live Q&As

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructor created an amazing learning environment, with clear explanations and examples that made complex concepts, like using R, easier to understand. The combination of lectures, hands-on exercises, and assignments allowed me to apply ecological theory to real-world situations, which I found incredibly valuable. I especially appreciated how the course helped me connect nature’s relationships to mathematical models. The instructor was incredibly fabulous in delivering the class.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Discussion of basic building blocks of food web theory, and how it can has counter-intuitive effect (3-species food chain; keystone predator)

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I can follow the instructor and the logic is nice

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: This class was incredibly stimulating, even though it was tough at the beginning, and I honestly thought I might not be able to keep up. However, the course was so well-designed that it pushed me to my limits and helped me grow. The clear structure, the challenging content, and the hands-on application of complex concepts kept me engaged. The difficulty actually made the learning experience more rewarding as I was able to overcome the challenges and gain a deeper understanding of the material.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Come if you want to learn how food web can change through time! I'll be mind blowing

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This class is highly recommended! It’s challenging but incredibly rewarding. If you're interested in food web theory, don't hesitate to take it!

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned the basic of many important ecological concepts like kin selection, competition, thermal ecology, etc.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- how to read papers more effectively
- how to interact with other students in a context of something that I am not an expert of
- how to prepare a discussion lead

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: new topics that I don't often apply to my science - animal behavior/ conflict and thermal ecology stood out as topics that were highly interesting but things I rarely think about

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Effective scientific writing, increased understanding of plant ecology and biodiversity, ways of interpreting data

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The discussion groups being randomly set each class helped me to hear from other students who have very different backgrounds than I do and who I might not interact with otherwise.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I enjoyed the class format of having two papers and the jigsaw method of discussion. As with all discussion based classes, a few individuals tended to dominate the class and some did not speak for the whole class. Not sure how to improve that, as it is a perennial problem, but it maybe reminding students midway through the semester to try to speak every class not speak if you have been the main person talking the class.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I enjoyed the fact that we always had one instructor sit in on the group discussion. I liked that they mostly let the students lead the discussion and only intervened when we had specific questions or wanted to guide us into a different direction.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I really enjoyed the layout of the class - I thought the ways that we split into groups and were encouraged to summarize the paper to others who hadn't read the paper was helpful for recalling what I read about. Some weeks we didn't get to hear summaries of all of the papers, so I wonder if each group had to post a short (2-3 sentence) summary of their paper to Sakai for everyone to see would be helpful in the future. That way, everyone has *at least* a brief summary of each paper by the end of the course. I also appreciated the ways that Jim & Justin participated in discussion constructively - it always provided new & unique perspectives from people who have been in the field longer than I. I also felt satisfied by the topics that we covered!

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I really like reading the classic papers

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Getting the know the literature of our PhD overarching topic was very helpful.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Group discussions are always stimulating, especially when the students are invested in the content! The way that different people got excited about different ideas or topics made this class stimulating and exciting!

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: If you want to understand a wide breadth of ecology, take this class! Low commitment relative to the knowledge gained.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: It is a very interesting and helpful course to get an overview about how individuals to communities were established in the literature in the topic of ecology.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: If you want to gain comprehensive background on ecological literature, this is the class for you! It is also a great class if you're trying to get better at reading papers and summarizing literature.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take it and have fun!
